akas: Ten Puppies and Us World-wide (English title) (alternative transliteration)
akas from release info: Ten Puppies and Us World-wide (English title) (alternative transliteration)

1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot: Louise helps a family deal with their new hell-raising chihuahua Chloe. A ski patroler adopts Jura, a border collie. A retired couple deals with their hyperactive pup Pedro. A housewife deals with her stubborn golden retriever, Lola.

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: Louise faces Lola and helps a jolly telephone psychic who loves big dogs pick between great dane Hank and leonberger Nelson. A 3-year-old girl pesters her new cocker spaniel pup Poppy. Jura trains to become a mountain rescue dog.

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: Louise helps a woman pick a labrador as the companion dog for her autistic 4-year-old son with Down's syndrome. A couple prepares their new pug Butch Cassidy for internet stardom. Chloe gets a new friend. Leonberger puppy makes a mess.

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: Series finale. Rescue pup Pippa won't stop chewing its owners' stuff. A family tries to teach their cockapoo Rosso to go potty. Will labrador Hunter make the boy happy? Louise faces the leonberger pup, Shiva. All 10 pups are revisited.

imdb.plot outline: Every year, we welcome a quarter of a million puppies into our homes. In this series, we follow ten of them and their families through their all-important first six months together. We explore how the nation's favourite pets develop, learn and adapt to their new world, and also the profound effects they can have on the lives of their owners, capturing both the mayhem and delight a new puppy brings, from toilet training and first walks to sleepless nights and getting used to their new owners. On hand to offer our families expert advice is dog behaviourist Louise Glazebrook.
imdb.title: 10 Puppies and Us
plot: Ten socioeconomically varied British households take on the potentially life-changing responsibility of a puppy. Over the course of six moths they must try to house-train 10 puppies of various breeds and personalities.

Every year, we welcome a quarter of a million puppies into our homes. In this series, we follow ten of them and their families through their all-important first six months together. We explore how the nation's favourite pets develop, learn and adapt to their new world, and also the profound effects they can have on the lives of their owners, capturing both the mayhem and delight a new puppy brings, from toilet training and first walks to sleepless nights and getting used to their new owners. On hand to offer our families expert advice is dog behaviourist Louise Glazebrook.::BBC's Official _Plot Summary_ (qv)
